caption.title: Logistic regressions of body mass ratios (a proxy for predation) and host genetic distance on the probability of CST.
caption.p: For each pair of host species, we ( A) calculated the log ratio of their average body masses and ( B) found the patristic genetic distance between them (from a maximum-likelihood tree of mtDNA). To investigate the association of these predictors with cross-species transmission, we treated transmission as a binary variable: 0 if the Bayes factor for the transmission (as inferred by the discrete traits model) was < 3.0, and 1 for a Bayes factor â‰¥ 3.0. Each plot shows raw predictor data in gray; the quintiles of the predictor data in green; and the logistic regression and 95% CI in blue.
